item.title: Decades after being blocked from the Little League World Series, a Black team is honored
item.description: A Black little league team that got invited to the 1963 Little League World Series but never got to go because of segregation is finally getting recognition.
item.content:encoded: A Black little league team that got invited to the 1963 Little League World Series but never got to go because of segregation is finally getting recognition.

item.title: Supreme Court appears split in tax foreclosure case
item.description: At issue is whether a county can seize homeowners' residence for unpaid property taxes and sell the house at auction for less than the homeowners would get if they put their home on the market themselves.

item.title: Cubans from US killed after speedboat opens fire on island's troops, Havana says
item.description: Cuba says the 10 passengers on a boat that opened fire on its soldiers were armed Cubans living in the U.S. who were trying to infiltrate the island and unleash terrorism. Secretary of State Marco Rubio says the U.S. is gathering its own information.

item.title: Greetings from Jordan's Wadi Rum desert, where patches of green emerge after winter rains
item.description: Wadi Rum's otherworldly landscape is where Star Wars movies and The Martian were filmed. In late winter, plants emerge in this desert — but some are toxic to camels, so their herders must protect them.
